body.p:
OFFICE LOUISVILLE CITY RAILWAY COMPANY,
Louisville, Ky., 23d Aug 1864.
Gov Thos E Bramlette
Executive Office
Frankfort Ky
Dear Governor

Knowing as I do your opinion that Kentuckians ought to command Kentuckians, I write to say that Capt Slater of 11th Ky Cavalry promoted to Major in the Regiment is an Indianean and not a Kentuckian Capt Mangam, of this city, of the 11th Ky Cavalry is one of the best officers in the Service. Col Adams who commanded the Brigade regards him as equal to any man known to him for coolness, courage & staid. I verily believe the Commission to the Indianean should be revoked and Mangam appointed. I am in averse to see men of other states command our troops that I am under and to write you on subject There is no doubt are have plenty of
competent men to command our own regiments.

Hartily & Truly
Yr Friend
J. T. Boyle

Louisville Ky
Aug. 23rd 1864.
Boyle J. T.
To Governor:

Stating that Capt. Slater of 11th Ky. Cav. recently made Maj. same Reg't. is an Indianian. Thinks Kentuckians should command Kentuckians. Recommends Capt. Mangam, 11th Ky. Cav'y as a No. 1. officer and one in every way worthy of the Majority. Thinks Slater's comn should be revoked and Mangam comnd in his stead.
L B No 6 - 1864 P. 90
Recd A. G. O. 24th Aug. 1864.
